verses.text: \w You|strong="H7760"\w* \w are|strong="H1121"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H3068"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w* \w your|strong="H3068"\w* \w God|strong="H3068"\w*; \w do|strong="H3068"\w* \w not|strong="H3808"\w* \w cut|strong="H1413"\w* \w yourselves|strong="H5869"\w* \w or|strong="H3808"\w* \w shave|strong="H7760"\w* \w your|strong="H3068"\w* foreheads \w on|strong="H7760"\w* behalf \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H3068"\w* \w dead|strong="H4191"\w*,

\w You|strong="H3605"\w* \w must|strong="H3808"\w* \w not|strong="H3808"\w* eat \w any|strong="H3605"\w* \w detestable|strong="H8441"\w* \w thing|strong="H8441"\w*.

\w These|strong="H2063"\w* are \w the|strong="H7716"\w* animals \w that|strong="H7794"\w* you may eat:\f + \fr 14:4 \ft The precise identification of some of the birds and animals in this chapter is uncertain.\f* The ox, the sheep, the goat,
the deer, the gazelle, the roe deer, the wild goat, the ibex, the antelope, and the mountain sheep.

\w You|strong="H3605"\w* may eat \w any|strong="H3605"\w* animal \w that|strong="H3605"\w* \w has|strong="H3605"\w* \w a|strong="H3068"\w* \w split|strong="H8156"\w* \w hoof|strong="H6541"\w* \w divided|strong="H6536"\w* \w in|strong="H5927"\w* \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w and|strong="H5927"\w* \w that|strong="H3605"\w* \w chews|strong="H5927"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w cud|strong="H1625"\w*.

\w But|strong="H3588"\w* \w of|strong="H3808"\w* \w those|strong="H1992"\w* \w that|strong="H3588"\w* \w chew|strong="H5927"\w* \w the|strong="H3588"\w* \w cud|strong="H1625"\w* \w or|strong="H3808"\w* \w have|strong="H3588"\w* \w a|strong="H3068"\w* completely \w divided|strong="H6536"\w* \w hoof|strong="H6541"\w*, \w you|strong="H3588"\w* \w are|strong="H1992"\w* \w not|strong="H3808"\w* \w to|strong="H5927"\w* eat \w the|strong="H3588"\w* following: the camel, the rabbit, or the rock badger.\f + \fr 14:7 \ft Or the coney or the hyrax\f* Although they chew the cud, they do not have a divided hoof. They are unclean for you,
as well as the pig; though it has a divided hoof, it does not chew the cud. It is unclean for you. You must not eat its meat or touch its carcass.

\w Of|strong="H4325"\w* \w all|strong="H3605"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* creatures \w that|strong="H3605"\w* live \w in|strong="H2088"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w water|strong="H4325"\w*, \w you|strong="H3605"\w* \w may|strong="H4325"\w* eat \w anything|strong="H3605"\w* \w with|strong="H4325"\w* \w fins|strong="H5579"\w* \w and|strong="H4325"\w* \w scales|strong="H7193"\w*,

\w You|strong="H3605"\w* \w may|strong="H2889"\w* eat \w any|strong="H3605"\w* \w clean|strong="H2889"\w* \w bird|strong="H6833"\w*,
\w but|strong="H3808"\w* \w these|strong="H2088"\w* \w you|strong="H3808"\w* \w may|strong="H1992"\w* \w not|strong="H3808"\w* eat: the eagle, the bearded vulture, the black vulture,
the red kite, the falcon, any kind of kite,
any kind of raven,
the ostrich,\f + \fr 14:15 \ft Literally the daughter of the ostrich or the daughter of the owl\f* the screech owl, the gull, any kind of hawk,
the little owl, the great owl, the white owl,
the desert owl, the osprey, the cormorant,
the stork, any kind of heron, the hoopoe, or the bat.

\w All|strong="H3605"\w* \w flying|strong="H5775"\w* \w insects|strong="H8318"\w* \w are|strong="H5775"\w* \w unclean|strong="H2931"\w* \w for|strong="H3605"\w* \w you|strong="H3605"\w*; \w they|strong="H3808"\w* \w may|strong="H1931"\w* \w not|strong="H3808"\w* \w be|strong="H3808"\w* eaten.

Giving Tithes (Leviticus 27:30–34; Deuteronomy 26:1–15; Nehemiah 13:10–14)

\w You|strong="H3605"\w* must \w be|strong="H8141"\w* sure \w to|strong="H3318"\w* \w set|strong="H3318"\w* aside \w a|strong="H3068"\w* \w tenth|strong="H6237"\w* \w of|strong="H8141"\w* \w all|strong="H3605"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w produce|strong="H8393"\w* \w brought|strong="H3318"\w* \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* \w each|strong="H3605"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* \w from|strong="H3318"\w* \w your|strong="H3605"\w* \w fields|strong="H7704"\w*.
